title: A Figgy Duff Christmas
creator_credit: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: For hundreds of years, Newfoundlanders have been celebrating Christmas, developing distinct traditions. One of these is figgy duff pudding. A musical group, named after the traditional dessert, play and sing the old songs sung at that time of the year.
creator_credit_for_label: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
